full_threads.body:
Hi Josephine,

Sure, confirming the star icons should be showing up on all pages.

Hi Joel,

Thanks for the update. I can see a big difference!

Can you please put the 5 stars (5/5) before "Client Testimonials" on the checkout page, cart page, and all other pages? They appear as small rectangles instead of stars.

They only appear as stars correctly on the home page. Thanks.

Kind regards,
Josephine



Josephine Roufaiel
Managing Director

venEyes 3D Printed Customised Eyewear
Ph: 02 7228 9228 | M: +61 422 066 357
josephine@veneyes.com.au | www.veneyes.com.au
19/591 Withers Road, Rouse Hill NSW 2155

Please consider our environment before printing this e-mail. This e-mail is confidential and should be read only by the intended recipient. If you are not the intended recipient, please notify us immediately by telephone or email and destroy and delete this message from your computer.

Hi Josephine,

We have made some updates to the site.
Let me know if this works for you?

Hi Chris,

Thanks for the changes.

I have noticed that the modifications I made on the back end appear immediately on the Desktop version but do not appear on the Mobile version.

1- Shop Optical button - appears on Desktop but not on Mobile - Attached photos.
2- Text changed on Customised pattern section - appears on Desktop but not on Mobile - Attached photos.
3- Text changed on Popup 10% off - appears on Desktop but not on Mobile - Attached photos.
4- When I clicked on Browse venEyes Collection - Mobile version, It opens to a page called veneyes.test.

If you could please have a look.

Kind regards,
Josephine

Josephine

Hi Josephine, 

Thanks for the email. 

There was some caching happening which was adding to the layout issues on the page.

Our senior developer will be working on this as a priority and I will provide an update as soon as possible.

@joel 

It looks like the cache issue is resolved as I can see all the heading text. Can you please go over the page to fix any alignment layout issues?

Hi Chris,

I am following up on the adjustments for the main page in the mobile version. I was only hoping that the justification of two titles would be cantered in the mobile version as per the attachments sent before.

I'm not sure what happened, but the whole page looks messed up and incorrect. It might have used the incorrect template; as far as I know, it was the Elementor template: 3608.
The home page is very important as I'm currently running ads.

If this will take some time to fix, please revert it to how it was. Could you please check and let me know? Please check the website on your mobile device to see what I mean. Attach some screenshots.

Thanks.

Kind regards,
Josephine

Thanks for the changes.

The cart icon appears okay.

Four times per day sounds good. I have tried it in incognito mode, and it works.
However, in mobile mode, it appeared once, but every time I refresh, it didn't appear again.

The five stars don't appear on the "Add to Cart" page. Please see the attached photo.

The homepage sections in mobile mode now appears messed up and not justified. Could you please take a look into this?

Kind regards,
Josephine

action.text: Glen Tenorio assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Joel,

Can you please check out the below?

Site: https://veneyes.com.au/

Thanks!

Hi Chris,

Could you please check the following points this month as I'm running ads? I believe they are small points. Please update me on the cost once the work is completed.


Can you check why the popup does not appear consistently? It appeared on my laptop once, and I was able to fill out the form, which worked well. However, it did not appear again on either desktop or mobile.

When adding glasses to the cart and proceeding, there is no cart icon to view the items in the cart if I go back to shopping. Can you please add the cart icon and ensure everything is working correctly?

The 5-stars icons before the review have disappeared.

In the mobile version, the wording is not cantered on the screen. Can you justify it? Please see the attached photos.


Thank you.

Kind regards,

Josephine




￼






Josephine Roufaiel
Managing Director

venEyes 3D Printed Customised Eyewear
